alert.note: Alert for Northwest Providence; Southeast Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Norfolk, west central Plymouth, northwestern Bristol and northeastern Providence Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 359 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Attleborough, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Heavy Rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Urban and poor drainage flooding possible in localized downpours. Locations impacted include... Brockton, Pawtucket, Taunton, Cumberland, Franklin, North Attleborough, Bridgewater, Attleboro, Mansfield, Middleborough, Easton, Lincoln, Central Falls, Norton, Sharon, Foxborough, Whitman, East Bridgewater, Seekonk and Raynham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
